body:
Comment 10: 
Regarding #8, it is seldom worth the effort and compromise to make C code GC-safe. 
There are many constructs that make this costly in terms of time and space at compile-
and run-time, especially when the optimizer is turned on.

It usually suffices to have a good description of what pointers are being used by C code
and a signal for the GC to examine these pointers.
